PAD_EnterCombat.synopsis: A player reacts to a surprise attack by a group of Sahuagin, amphibian monsters that swam out of the water on a Baldur's Gate beach and attack everything in sight, including civilians.
PAD_EnterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- When you enter combat with the Sahuagin, the first player to get a turn will do this PAD once

PAD_AfterCombat.synopsis: A player remarks on a combat encounter with a Sahuagin that appeared on a beach in the Lower City. When the player approaches the shore, they come out of the sea and start attacking.Their presence alludes to the Iron Throne situation, as made clear through loot on their corpses. Sahuagin are scary-looking antropomorphic amphibians, sometimes called "sea devils" or "fish heads" (derogatory).Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-gin.
PAD_AfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- This PAD will play after a short delay, on a player who was in that combat.

AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (female human near the fishmonger) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once the Sahuagin are defeated.
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to this civilian looking at the fish near the fishmonger:S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_FishCustomer_d861fb4a-f98c-416a-88a5-a07525b62554

AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (sailor on the boat) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to the civilian on the boat.S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_Boat_f699d950-c10b-424d-98d2-cdce112a3313

AD_Fishmonger_Idle.synopsis: Repeated sequential AD for idle behaviours of the fishmonger from the Sahuagin Attack booster. He will repeat this AD before the Sahuagin come up from the water to attack.
AD_Fishmonger_Idle.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 44 3 -146"- Observe the fishmonger repeating this idle AD.

AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat.synopsis: After a Sahuagin attack on a small beach in Baldur's Gate, a nearby fishmonger and, optionally, their customer, comments on the dead Sahuagin.
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- After the Sahuagin are defeated and the player does a PAD to react to it, the fishmonger will play this AD once. If their customer survived the attack too, they will be included.

Civilian_ThanksAfterCombat.synopsis: Short dialogue where a civilian, saved by the players from a Sahuagin attack on a small beach in Baldur's Gate,
Civilian_ThanksAfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- This dialogue will play after a short delay, between a player who was in that combat and one of the civilians here.

AfterCombat_Civilian_001.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (female gnome near the docks) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once the Sahuagin are defeated.
AfterCombat_Civilian_001.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to this civilian near the docks:S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_001_912002e8-480d-4039-a75d-fb2e2796976d

AfterCombat_Civilian_003.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (male halfling patrolling near the fishmonger) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once the Sahuagin are defeated.
AfterCombat_Civilian_003.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to this civilian near the docks:S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_003_7d8d9cb0-eb53-402b-a5a7-e8878da2427f

AD_Sailor_AfterCombat.synopsis: After a Sahuagin attack on a small beach in Baldur's Gate, a nearby sailor comments on the dead Sahuagin.
AD_Sailor_AfterCombat.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- After the Sahuagin are defeated and the player does a PAD to react to it, the sailor will play this AD once.

AfterCombat_Civilian_004.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (female half-elf patrolling near the fishmonger) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once the Sahuagin are defeated.
AfterCombat_Civilian_004.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to this civilian near the docks:S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_004_9f40425a-aa24-4051-8b22-5ccb15a3dfba

AfterCombat_Civilian_002.synopsis: Default dialogue with one of the civilians (male gnome near the docks) near the Sahuagin attack on a shore in the Lower City. This dialogue only gets added once the Sahuagin are defeated.
AfterCombat_Civilian_002.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 52 3 -138"- "killcombat" to kill all the Sahuagin after they appear and attack.- Talk to this civilian near the docks:S_LOW_BeachSahuagin_Civilian_002_da3dafe4-f014-41e1-8dfe-56670ac9fd0a

Fishmonger.synopsis: Default dialogue with the fishmonger at the Sahuagin attack booster on the shore in the Lower City. Will sell fish, as fishmongers do, and say different things depending on the state of the Sahuagin.
Fishmonger.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Use ReCon command "goto 43 3 -148"- Talk to the fishmonger.- To trigger the other flags, approach the docks, Sahuagin will appear - killcombat. For the "cleaned up" flag to be set, do a long rest.

PAD_AfterCombat_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombat_0.text: Sahuagin. But why are they so close to the city?
PAD_AfterCombat_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-ginNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-gin

PAD_AfterCombat_1.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombat_1.text: More of those creatures. Not sure why they're attacking out in the open like this.
PAD_AfterCombat_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-ginNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-gin

PAD_AfterCombat_2.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterCombat_2.text: What are these things? And gods, do they stink.
PAD_AfterCombat_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-ginNodeContext: Sahuagin is pronounced sah-HWAH-gin

AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_0.speaker: Hucinda
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_0.text: Did you hear this was the best place to buy fish in the city as well? Seems they neglected to mention the sea devils!
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_0.context: NodeContext: Indignant after almost getting killed by sahuagin

AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_1.speaker: Hucinda
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_1.text: Gods, do you think they're going to chop them up and sell them? I bloody hope not.

AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_2.speaker: Hucinda
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_2.text: Glad they got those sea devils cleaned up. Just hope that's the last of them.

AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_3.speaker: Hucinda
AfterCombat_Civilian_FishCustomer_3.text: You... you don't think they sold those creatures' bits to the fishmongers, do you?

AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_0.speaker: Sailor Peete
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_0.text: I hope the Wavemother sees fit to wash this stench away. It's burning my nose hairs...

AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_1.speaker: Sailor Peete
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_1.text: Did you see?! They popped up out of the water all around me! Bitch Queen's mercy...
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_1.context: NodeContext: Still pretty panicked after the fight

AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_2.speaker: Sailor Peete
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_2.text: I'm glad they're dead, but what do we do with them now? They smell awful already.

AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_3.speaker: Sailor Peete
AfterCombat_Civilian_Boat_3.text: They might've cleaned them up, but I can still smell those fish creatures. Worse than feeling seasick.

AD_Fishmonger_Idle_0.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_Idle_0.text: Fish here! Get yer fish here!

AD_Fishmonger_Idle_1.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_Idle_1.text: Fresh, tasty fish straight from the Wavemother's bosom!

AD_Fishmonger_Idle_2.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_Idle_2.text: You can have any fish you like as long as it's halibut!

AD_Fishmonger_Idle_3.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_Idle_3.text: You know what they say - plenty of fish, plenty of friends!

AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_1.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_1.text: Thought I'd be used to the smell of fish by now. Not this smell. Ugh.
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_1.context: NodeContext: Disgusted by the smell of dead 'fish'

AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_0.speaker: Hucinda
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_0.text: I think I might've had my fill of fish for the next few tendays.
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_0.context: NodeContext: Disgusted by the smell of dead 'fish' trying not to retch

AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_2.speaker: Old Troutman
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_2.text: Having these things lying around is bad for business...
AD_Fishmonger_AfterCombat_2.context: NodeContext: Still disgusted and also a little annoyed

Civilian_ThanksAfterCombat_0.speaker: Flaheerta, Sailor Peete, Hucinda, Old Troutman, Rossina, Grout, Nonabune
Civilian_ThanksAfterCombat_0.text: Thank you for cutting those creatures down, truly. Gods know what would've happened if you weren't here.

AfterCombat_Civilian_001_0.speaker: Rossina
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_0.text: Well, that could have gone a lot worse - thanks for that.
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_0.context: NodeContext: Relieved now the sahuagin monsters are dead

AfterCombat_Civilian_001_1.speaker: Rossina
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_1.text: Next time I might suggest we go for a walk somewhere else - away from any water.

AfterCombat_Civilian_001_2.speaker: Rossina
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_2.text: I have to admit being attacked by sea devils definitely isn't my best date - but it wasn't the worst, either.
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_2.context: NodeContext: Relived after the attack (and trying to cope with a little humour)

AfterCombat_Civilian_001_3.speaker: Rossina
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_3.text: Can't say I'm not expecting more of those sea devils to pop out of the water - let's hope they don't.
AfterCombat_Civilian_001_3.context: NodeContext: With a touch of mirth but also genuinely wary

AfterCombat_Civilian_003_0.speaker: Nonabune
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_0.text: I mean, if 'When Fish Fight Back' doesn't tickle your fancy, how about... I don't know. That was the best one, to be honest.
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_0.context: NodeContext: Strangely exhilarated by the monster fight he just witnessed (but losing a bit of momentum at his lack of alternative titles)

AfterCombat_Civilian_003_1.speaker: Nonabune
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_1.text: Someone said those fish monsters exist because of the stuff we dump in the harbour. Maybe we should start dumping more...

AfterCombat_Civilian_003_2.speaker: Nonabune
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_2.text: That. Was. Incredible! And just think what a story it'd make: 'When Fish Fight Back'!
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_2.context: NodeContext: Strangely exhilarated by the monster fight he just witnessed

AfterCombat_Civilian_003_3.speaker: Nonabune
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_3.text: Do you reckon those fish things are gonna come back? I mean, I hope not, but that's probably the most exciting thing I've seen happen here.
AfterCombat_Civilian_003_3.context: NodeContext: Oddly almost wistful; misses the excitement

AD_Sailor_AfterCombat_0.speaker: Sailor Peete
AD_Sailor_AfterCombat_0.text: Oh gods, there's guts all over my boat!

AfterCombat_Civilian_004_0.speaker: Flaheerta
AfterCombat_Civilian_004_0.text: I saw you fighting those monsters! You were magnificent! I think. I mean, I couldn't really see from where I was - but I bet you were!

AfterCombat_Civilian_004_1.speaker: Flaheerta
AfterCombat_Civilian_004_1.text: The blood and bodies may be gone but I still remember your glorious heroism. Wonderful. Just wonderful.

AfterCombat_Civilian_004_2.speaker: Flaheerta
AfterCombat_Civilian_004_2.text: I just feel so much safer knowing there's people like you around to defend us. Those creatures'll think twice next time!

AfterCombat_Civilian_004_3.speaker: Flaheerta
AfterCombat_Civilian_004_3.text: I remember you! You were here when those sahuagin attacked! Thank you!

AfterCombat_Civilian_002_0.speaker: Grout
AfterCombat_Civilian_002_0.text: It's certainly a lot nicer here without sea devil corpses strewn everywhere.

AfterCombat_Civilian_002_1.speaker: Grout
AfterCombat_Civilian_002_1.text: Gods - all we wanted was a nice dockside walk, not an unscheduled menagerie visit.
AfterCombat_Civilian_002_1.context: NodeContext: Still recovering from the shock of the monster attack - but still indignant with it

AfterCombat_Civilian_002_2.speaker: Grout
AfterCombat_Civilian_002_2.text: Finally! Those awful things have been dealt with - and not a moment too soon.

AfterCombat_Civilian_002_3.speaker: Grout
AfterCombat_Civilian_002_3.text: Disgusting creatures - I hope they dispose of them soon.

Fishmonger_2.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_2.text: All right, mate? What can I get you this time?
Fishmonger_2.context: NodeContext: Trying to maintain cheerful market seller vibes

Fishmonger_14.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_14.text: Same old, same old - the Absolute's closing in and the Steel Watch is breathing down our necks. But still we fish.
Fishmonger_14.context: NodeContext: A little subdued but conversational

Fishmonger_15.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_15.text: A bit quieter after the sahuagin attack but that's to be expected - loyal customers'll be back.
Fishmonger_15.context: NodeContext: A little subdued but conversational (and sure his fish will lure back his customers)

Fishmonger_7.speaker: Player
Fishmonger_7.text: What do you have in stock?

Fishmonger_4.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_4.text: Fish, mainly. But I found a few shiny bits in the latest catch. Willing to sell them for a fair price, if you fancy.

Fishmonger_1.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_1.text: Fish, mainly. The Flaming Fist commandeer the best stuff but I can show you what I've got.
Fishmonger_1.context: NodeContext: Fairly cheerful but also matter of fact

Fishmonger_10.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_10.text: Watch yourself, eh? Gods willing there won't be any more of those things.
Fishmonger_10.context: NodeContext: Kindly warning for the player to be careful

Fishmonger_3.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_3.text: Thanks again for dealing with those sahuagin - you saved more than just my livelihood!

Fishmonger_8.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_8.text: Fancy any fish, then? You'll not find fresher inside the city.

Fishmonger_11.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_11.text: Our hero's back! Fancy any celebratory seafood?

Fishmonger_12.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_12.text: You buying, mate? Not a lot left.
Fishmonger_12.context: NodeContext: Trying to maintain cheerful market seller vibes

Fishmonger_13.speaker: Old Troutman
Fishmonger_13.text: You'll be pleased to know those sahuagin you offed have been cleaned up - gods, the smell.
Fishmonger_13.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheerful (disgusted on "gods, the smell")
